In this lesson, we will continue our journey on using transportation in Japanese. We'll learn phrases such as "Does this go to", "When is the next", and "How long does it take".
Let's begin with the phrase "Does this go to". In Japanese, you say:

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . The blank space is where you insert your destination. For example, to ask "Does this go to Tokyo?", you say:

lang.mstts:prosody: これは東京に行きますか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Once again, "Does this go to Tokyo?" is:

lang.mstts:prosody: これは東京に行きますか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
Next, we have "When is the next". That translates to:

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . So, if you want to ask "When is the next train?", you say:

lang.mstts:prosody: 次の電車はいつですか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Repeating, "When is the next train?" is:

lang.mstts:prosody: 次の電車はいつですか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
Finally, "How long does it take". In Japanese, it's:

lang.mstts:prosody: どれくらいかかりますか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Let's use this in a sentence: "How long does it take to get to Kyoto station from here?". You'd say:

lang.mstts:prosody: ここから京都駅までどれくらいかかりますか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Let's repeat that once more, "How long does it take to get to Kyoto station from here?" is:

lang.mstts:prosody: ここから京都駅までどれくらいかかりますか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
In this lesson, you've learned how to say "Does this go to" as

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: , and "How long does it take" as

lang.mstts:prosody: どれくらいかかりますか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: , respectively. This concludes our lesson on using transportation phrases in Japanese.
